body: Yay its October! Woo hoo! Who celebrates halloween here? What are you guys dressing up as? Im gonna be a gorilla. Are you guys gonna go trick or treating? replies.body:
Here in New Zealand it's quite uncommon to celebrate Halloween. Seems like a very American thing to do.

So to answer the OP, I have never trick or treated or anything like that.

Here in New Zealand it's quite uncommon to celebrate Halloween. Seems like a very American thing to do.

replies.body:
November 2, 2013.

So,
October 31 (Halloween) = Friday
November 1 = Saturday 
November 2 (Birthday) = Sunday
replies.body_tagged:
November 2, 2013.

October 31 (Halloween) = Friday
November 1 = Saturday 
November 2 (Birthday) = Sunday

replies.body:
I don't celebrate it; it actually has a religious meaning! :P
Halloween is a representation of ghosts and skeletons and things like that, but if you guys are religious, you would know where "Halloween" actually came from. :)
